com.logitopia.jmortar.core.service.impl

Class AbstractService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.logitopia.jmortar.core.service.impl.AbstractService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service

    public abstract class AbstractService
extends java.lang.Object
implements Service
    The AbstractService class is an abstract representation of the Service interface. It implements the core functionality of the Service interface allowing concrete implementations to concentrate on specifics.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        The getName method returns the name of this service. Whatever the name of this service is set to upon construction is what will be returned as a String.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Service
        Returns:
        String The name of this service.

      • getStatus

        public final int getStatus()
        The getStatus method returns the status of the service. Whatever state the service is in when this method is executed is the value that will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface Service
        Returns:
        int The state that the service is currently in.

        public final boolean isErrored()

      • shutdown

        public abstract boolean shutdown()

      • initialise

        public abstract boolean initialise()
        Start procedure - Stage One - Initialise. When the service starts the first part of the procedure is to "initialise" the module. This can involve creating new instances of members e.t.c.
        Returns:
        A success flag (true == success)

      • validate

        public abstract boolean validate()
        Start procedure - Stage Two - Validate. Once all of the services members have been initialised, the next step is to perform validation to ensure that the service is ready to run.
        Returns:
        A success flag (true == success)

      • startup

        public abstract boolean startup()
        Start procedure - Stage Three - Startup. Once all validation has been carried out, this method is implemented by the base implementation to perform any startup or calibration that is required of service members.
        Returns:
        A success flag (true == success)

      • postStart

        public abstract boolean postStart()
        Start procedure - Stage Four - Post Start. Once the service is started, any post-startup calibration can be carried out here.
        Returns:
        A success flag (true == success)

      • start

        public final void start()
                 throws ServiceException
        The start method initiates the service and is responsible for setting the service status at every stage of initiation. The primary responsibility of this method is to ensure that this service gets from new or stopped to running.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Service
        Throws:
        ServiceException - An exceptional state when the service is unable to start.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
                throws ServiceException
        The stop method terminates the service and sets the service status at every stage of termination. The primary responsibility of this method is to ensure that this service gets from running to stopped.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Service
        Throws:
        ServiceException - An exceptional state when the service is unable to stop.
